    Very wide chef knife. Smooth-cutting chef knife. Very sharp. Has extra heft to help power through the job, even on tougher cuts. We were worried the rubber-type grip handle would be cheesy or cheap, but it is actually really nice, and very helpful to prevent slips. Also great for use to scoop up what you've cut to quickly dump it in a pan.

    Excellent knife , the blade is extra wide which is a plus and is very sharp , the price is unbeatable i will be buying more and i highly recommend it .

    Hicham T. from Allina's Pizza Posted on 12/19/2017

    Great Knife .

    Very nice knife for the price. I love the extra wide blade (great for picking up cut items on the knife) and the fact that this knife is very sharp. Not sure how long it will hold an edge but the blade looks very well made so I expect it will stay sharp with minimal maintenance.

    Kent D. Posted on 09/05/2017

    These wide chef knives are great for our food prep!! We use them daily and they do not dull quickly. Great price for the quality!!

    I really like this Chef Knife. I have knifes in my collection from very well knows and expensive brands and this compares in quality. I really like the rubberized handle. It is very easy to handle this knife due to the comfort of the handle.

    Nelli B. Posted on 06/14/2017

    Purchased this knife because of it's 2 knife angles and that it is half as wide again as a standard 8" chef blade. The wide blade made it so easy to use the knife along with my hand to get everything off the cutting board and into the pot. It's my go to for big root veggies and hard squash. It's my first Mercer and the blade shaved the hair off my arm right out of the box. It holds it's edge great and the handle can't be beat for comfort and washability.

    Russell H. Posted on 05/11/2017

    Anthony G. Posted on 08/19/2015

    This is my first wide blade chefs knife. I'm used to the narrower blades but this one seems to do just fine. I do a lot of chopping and mincing and this baby can get it done.     the mercer m18000 wide blade knife is great! It's well balanced and the weight of the blade allows you to cut through even the hardest of cabbage heads with ease. No slipping or sliding off the item. The blade is sharp, the handle has a goo and positive feel and the price was right. I'd buy more but I need to find a place to store them

    Joseph D. Posted on 03/25/2015

    First wide knife I have owned. Has been a pleasure using it. Slicing onions evenly in 1/8 slices. Makes chopping and dicing easy. Been using it daily since I got it.

    Randy F. Posted on 08/23/2014

    Highly satisfactory basic chef's tool. While the knife was only recently received, and the durability is unknown, the workmanship, fit, and finish are excellent, and give every indication of a long service life. The knife as received is razor sharp across the entire blade from tip to heel by the paper test, and is ready to use. It is somewhat heavier than I expected, about like the premium forged chefs knives, but this has proven to be a plus in that the weight of the knife assists in many tasks. The lack of a bolster should be a plus when sharpening, and its lack is not noticeable in use. The curve of the blade has proven to be ideal for my particular dicing style, and the blade is thin enough to allow easy horizontal cuts for onion dicing. The handle is a good fit (I have small hands and wear a small mens' size glove), and the top edges of the blade are not sharp allowing a comfortable “pinch” grip. The wide blade provides additional knuckle clearance, and is helpful in transferring product from the cutting board, and seems to make bell pepper prep easier. Be sure to buy the Mercer edge guard unless your knives are always kept in a block or on a magnetic holder. Not a knife to be left in a drawer – bad for the knife and bad for the person reaching in the drawer. Unka' George – a highly satisfied WEBstaurant customer

    George M. Posted on 08/18/2014

    A good sharp knife. Holds its edge very well, easy to clean easy to sharpen. I especially like a blade heavy knife and this is it, I hold the blade when I cut and with that extra wide front it makes cutting easier, faster and more controlled.

    Alicia K. from Bagels & Beyond Posted on 05/12/2014

    The mercer Millennia Line is second to none, great knives for chopping and mincing and are very well made very sharp as well an amazing value from Webstaurant.
